<br> Once upon a time, the data archives for social science research were seen in the Western Europe only. The Council of European Social Science Data Archives (CESSDA), in collaboration with the International Asociation for Social Science Information Service & Technology (IASSIST) organized a dedicated workshop, intending to foster activity in the newly emerged countries from the Iron Curtain, in the Eastern Europe. This Amsterdam meeting was so promising that CESSDA went further organizing this network, in spite of a deep-rooted instinct of protecting data against any person or institution.
